name: FUSS - Free Upgrade for a digitally Sustainable School
description:
FUSS is a complete GNU/Linux solution based on Debian and around 200 educational software packages for schools. It is in the meantime a digital sustainability project that since 2005 gives students and teachers the
opportunity to use at home the same tools installed at school, freely and without any cost for families.

sdgs.relevance:
- SDG4 Quality Education: we want to ensure that there is no digital divide in education. Every student must have equal rights and be able to access digital learning tools without cost aggravations for families.

- SDG9 Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure: It is recognized that using FOSS, open standards and open content is a very powerful means to foster innovation in industry leveraging the the expertise of IT companies that every country has. Using FOSS in schools allows us to cultivate future curious innovators and inventors and not just technology tourists.

openStandards: As most of the GNU/Linux distributions
FUSS with its collection of educational applications uses a plethora of open formats

open protocols and open standards both at kernel/library and application level. Most of them are covered in this list: https://github.com/DPGAlliance/publicgoods-candidates/blob/main/help-center/open-standards.md

At application level I would add an important Open Standard which is the Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) which is used by LibreOffice and other office suites and applications in FUSS. In our local experience (South Tyrol
Italy) it is used by all schools in Italian language (74 schools

16000 students) and by the local public administrations in order to have an office exchange format with citizens (including students/parents in public schools). Thi is the list of open formats foreseen by the Autonomous PRovincie of Bozen-Bolzano: https://data.civis.bz.it/it/formats
bestPractices:
The FUSS project follows these main architectural principles:

- It uses and develops Free and open-source software (https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss)
- It uses Web Standards

in particular for the main configuration application called OctoNet (https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss/octonet) developed using the Django framework
- Build with modern and popular frameworks: 
-- Django cited above
-- GIT and GitLab for code/documentation versioning (https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss)
-- Sphinx and the RST-format for the project documentation (https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss/fuss-tech-guide

https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss/fuss-user-guide)
-- Ansible and YAML for configuration management

software provisioning and application deployment both on server and client side (see fuss-server: https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss/fuss-server and fuss-client: https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss/fuss-client)

- Modularity and Maintainability: the use of the Debian packaging system (apt) for both standard and custom (created by FUSS) packages along with the use of Ansible helps us comply with this architectural principle. 

- Furthermore whenever possible we apply the first item of the Unix philosophy: "Make each program do one thing well."
deploymentCountriesDepartments: FUSS is not only used in schools and educational institutions. During the pandemic period and afterwards
several employees of the local public administration needed to reuse old PCs/notebooks for smart working from home. With a view to circular economy and digital sustainability
the FUSS system and applications required for smart working were installed on numerous used machines. See this article: https://fuss.bz.it/post/2020-04-17_fuss-in-amministrazione/
otherDeploymentOrganisations: FUSS is used not only in by public schools of the Province of Bolzano (Italy)

more than 600 families in our region (Autonomous Province of Bozen-Bolzano) have received a refurbished PC for free with FUSS on board. The initiative called SchoolSwap (https://schoolswap.bz.it) is carried out by several local associations (LUGBZ
Jugenddienst) and by the FUSS Project. PCs and notebooks were/are donated by companies
public institutions and citizens. A group of volunteers in several labs take care of the whole refurbishment cycle and final system installation.

privacy.privacyCompliance:
1) CAD - Codice dell'Amministrazione Digitale (DECRETO LEGISLATIVO 7 marzo 2005, n. 82), in particular articles 68 and 69 (acquisition and reuse of software by public administrations - see. guidelines https://www.agid.gov.it/it/design-servizi/riuso-open-source/linee-guida-acquisizione-riuso-software-pa).

2) General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
privacy.privacyComplianceURL:
1) The project respects the Italian Code for Digital Administration even before Articles 68 and 69 reached their current form (May 2023). 
- Specifically, Article 68 of the CAD requires that acquisition of open source software or reuse of existing software should always be considered before other solutions by public administrations. 
-- FUSS is based exclusively on FOSS software (https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss) and therefore complies with Article 68.

- Article 69 of CAD requires that public administrations that own IT solutions are obliged to publish the source code in a public repository along with the documentation under an open license. In addition, the solutions are to be published on the platform of the Agency for Digital Italy (AgID). 
-- FUSS also fully complies with this article as all code and documentation are published under an open license at https://gitlab.fuss.bz.it/fuss . In addition, as requested, the project is published on the AgID Developers Italia platform: https://developers.italia.it/it/software/p_bz-fuss-fuss-metadata

2) The FUSS operating system (server and client) maintains user data within the institution that installs it; these data (first name, last name, groups/permissions, personal folder) are accessible only to the user and the system administrator (typically the controller appointed by the owner). None of this data is transmitted outside the institution where FUSS is installed.
These are the basic foundations that FUSS adopts to comply with the principle of privacy by design in line with the minimum security measures for Italian public administrations.

It will then be up to each organization that installs FUSS to comply with the principles and adopt organizational and security procedures so that the risk on the data processed is low, verifying that the entire chain of controllers is also compliant, from the data controllers to the processors.
The data controller, its employees, and the data processors must be trained and informed about what the GDPR requires, what personal data are, what sensitive data are, what a Data Breach (or data breach) is and how to handle it, and what to do to protect personal data.
